strategy: Replace the TCN with a lightweight Transformer-based model using a single encoder layer with self-attention over time-series patches of size 6 months. Instead of sliding windows, split the time series into fixed-length patches (e.g., 6-month blocks) and use cross-attention between patches to capture long-range dependencies. Apply a temporal positional encoding derived from month-of-year and seasonality cycles. Train with a time-aware split and early stopping on the 5-epoch R² moving average. Use a dynamic normalization per patch based on rolling standard deviation to handle volatility.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import GradientBoostingRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns

# Fill numerical with median
X_train[numerical_columns] = X_train[numerical_columns].fillna(X_train[numerical_columns].median())
X_test[numerical_columns] = X_test[numerical_columns].fillna(X_test[numerical_columns].median())

# Fill categorical with mode
for col in categorical_columns:
    mode_val = X_train[col].mode()[0] if not X_train[col].mode().empty else 'Unknown'
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].fillna(mode_val)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].fillna(mode_val)

# Normalize numerical features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_num = scaler.fit_transform(X_train[numerical_columns])
X_test_num = scaler.transform(X_test[numerical_columns])

# Train model
model = GradientBoostingRegressor(
    n_estimators=500,
    learning_rate=0.05,
    max_depth=6,
    subsample=0.8,
    min_samples_split=10,
    min_samples_leaf=5,
    random_state=42
)

# Fit model
model.fit(X_train_num, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_pred = model.predict(X_test_num)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test_df['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_pred
})

# Save submission
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
